snippet: 40,671 employers across 42 countries were asked about their third quarter hiring intentions and the reasoning behind their decisions in the latest edition of the ManpowerGroup Employment Outlook Survey.

Global Net Employment Outlook is 24%. This is calculated by subtracting employers planning reductions vs. those planning to hire. It weakened by 1 point since the previous quarter and increased by 2 points since Q3 2024.
37% of employers who plan to hire reported that their company is expanding in size, creating more positions.
The highest global hiring demand is in Information Technology and in Finance and Real Estate.
Global Net Employment Outlook is 24% for Q3 2025.
Outlook weakened by 1 point since Q2 2025, and increased by 2 points year-over-year compared with Q3 2024.
Regional comparisons: APAC Outlook 29%, Americas 27%, EMEA 19%.
Strongest country-level hiring demand: United Arab Emirates 48%, India 42%, Costa Rica 41%.
Weakest country-level hiring demand: Argentina 3%, Hungary 5%, Hong Kong 8%.
By industry sector: Information Technology 36%, Financials 28%, Industrials 26%.
Asia-Pacific Net Employment Outlook is 29% for Q3 2025.
The APAC Outlook weakened by 2 points quarter-over-quarter and strengthened by 3 points compared with Q3 2024.
APAC countries with strongest demand: India 42%, Australia 34%, China 30%.
APAC countries with weakest demand: Hong Kong 8%, Japan 12%, Taiwan 15%.
Americas Net Employment Outlook is 27% for Q3 2025.
The Americas Outlook strengthened by 2 points quarter-over-quarter and 4 points compared with Q3 2024.
Strongest hiring intentions: Costa Rica 41%, United States 34%, Mexico 31%.
Weakest hiring intentions: Argentina 3%, Colombia 17%, Brazil 18%.
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Net Employment Outlook is 19% for Q3 2025.
The EMEA Outlook weakened by 1 point since last quarter, and remained flat compared with Q3 2024.
Strongest hiring demand: United Arab Emirates 48%, South Africa 32%, Netherlands 28%.
Weakest hiring demand: Hungary 5%, Czech Republic 8%, Italy 9%.
37% of employers who plan to hire reported that their company is expanding in size, creating more positions.
30% of employers stated that increased demand for skills is the primary reason for hiring.
22% of employers reported hiring to replace staff who left voluntarily or involuntarily.
11% of employers are hiring to support organizational restructuring or transformation.
Employers cite the top three reasons for not hiring as automation gains, efficiency improvements, and uncertain economic outlook.
Information Technology has the strongest hiring outlook globally at 36%.
Financials and Real Estate report a Net Employment Outlook of 28%.
Industrials report a Net Employment Outlook of 26%.
Healthcare and Life Sciences show a Net Employment Outlook of 25%.
Consumer Goods and Services show a Net Employment Outlook of 23%.
Communication Services show a Net Employment Outlook of 22%.
Energy and Utilities show a Net Employment Outlook of 20%.
Public Services show a Net Employment Outlook of 18%.
The weakest sector is Education with a Net Employment Outlook of 15%.
The ManpowerGroup Employment Outlook Survey (MEOS) is conducted quarterly to measure employers' hiring intentions for the upcoming quarter.
For Q3 2025, interviews were conducted with 40,671 employers across 42 countries and territories.
The Net Employment Outlook is derived by subtracting the percentage of employers anticipating a decrease in headcount from the percentage anticipating an increase.
Data is collected through structured interviews and is seasonally adjusted to provide more meaningful comparisons.
